mods.abstract: T. B. Sutton Store, Granville, which shows black and white men sitting on benches outside the store.

This store was officially entered into the National Register of Historic Places by the United States Department of the Interior on May 7, 2019. It is the sixth National Register site in Jackson County, Tennessee. Soon after construction of the store, William H. Ragland sold the property to B.F. Cooper who owned it until his death in 1923 when it passed to his successor A.H. Willoughby. In 1925, Thomas Benjamin Sutton (T.B. Sutton or Ben Sutton) became the owner. Under Ben Sutton�s ownership, the store�s role in the community grew as it became the most prosperous commercial center in the Granville community.

titleInfo.title: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
